bullets.text: Trump says global tariff will rise to 15% immediately, escalating trade-war risk and likely raising import costs, inflation pressures, and retaliation odds.
Supreme Court rebuke of tariff authority sets up prolonged legal fight and potential multi‑billion dollar refund claims, creating uncertainty for firms and Treasury revenue.
Tariff dispute exposes fractures among conservative justices, signaling higher judicial risk for future executive economic actions implemented via emergency powers.
Trump pulls political support from a House Republican opposing tariffs, underscoring party discipline efforts that could harden protectionist policy direction.
U.S. strike on Iran seen as potentially riskier than Venezuela operation, implying higher escalation, regional spillovers, and energy-market shock risk.
Anti-regime student protests as Iranian universities reopen indicate persistent domestic instability, complicating Tehran’s governance and external posture amid regional tensions.
Major East Coast blizzard drives flight cancellations and travel disruption, highlighting weather-related operational risk and near-term revenue pressure for airlines and logistics.
Berkshire was a net seller of stocks in Buffett’s final quarter as CEO, suggesting a more cautious stance on equity valuations and/or desire for liquidity.
India’s AI summit spotlights large investment ambitions but execution frictions; progress could reshape global AI supply chains, talent competition, and cloud demand.
China’s CXMT offering DDR4 at about half market prices threatens memory-industry margins and could accelerate price competition across legacy DRAM segments.
AI data centers exploring high-temperature superconductors signals intensifying focus on power delivery and efficiency constraints as compute growth collides with grid limits.
NASA Artemis rocket helium issue delays Moon mission timelines, affecting contractor schedules and the pace of lunar science and commercialization plans.
Studies link common pneumonia bacterium to Alzheimer’s mechanisms and show high altitude may protect against diabetes, pointing to new prevention and therapeutic targets.
